title: Date Bar
custom_preconds:
https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-8942

"Featured" game - The featured game is what the Team page's Game Detail section will open by default to.  This should be the current day's game (after 10 AM flip) or the next game for that team.

http://mlb.mlb.com/v1/team/atbat/en/ios/phone/bal.json

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Team Page initially loads
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the "featured" game will be displayed on the second date of the 4 dates on the date bar
And the 5th block will contain the Team's full Schedule

custom_steps_separated.content: When an iPhone 6 Plus user views the date bar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be see 5 dates on the date bar
And the "featured" game will be displayed on the second date of the 5 dates on the date bar
And the 6th block will contain the Team's full Schedule

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the current date is on or before the beginning of the season (or date range)
And the user opens the Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the "featured" game will be the first game of the season
And will be displayed in the first block of the date bar

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the current date is on or after the end of the season (or date range)
And the user opens the Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the "featured" game will be the last game of the season
And will be displayed as the fourth block of the date bar (or fifth on the iPhone 6 Plus)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Schedule block on the date bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the Team's Schedule view (Calendar/List)

custom_steps_separated.content: When we swipe the Game Details section to the left/right
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the date bar will scroll to the left/right
And highlight the game displaying below in the Game Details section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the date bar
And the local, current time is before 10 AM
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the previous day's game will be located on the second date of the 4 dates on the date bar
And will be selected by default

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the date bar
And the local, current time is after 10 AM
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then today's (or the next game) will be located on the second date of the 4 dates on the date bar
And will be selected by default

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you look at the date bar
And there is no game scheduled for a date
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the date with no game scheduled will be skipped on the date bar

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And the team has an Away game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Away game will display the opponent as "@OAK" (for example)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And the team has an Home game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Home game will display the opponent as "OAK" (for example)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Scheduled game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Scheduled game will display the day, date, Opponent, and start time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a game in progress present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game in progress will display day, date, Opponent, and "LIVE"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a game in a Final state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the completed game in progress will display day, date, Opponent, and the final score

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Postponed game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Postponed game will display day, date, Opponent, and "PPD"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Suspended game present
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Suspended game will display day, date, Opponent, and "SUSP"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Suspended-Resumed game displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The Resumed Game will be displayed in the cell for the date that the game is being played on
And when the user navigates to that cell, the date for the game will remain as the date the Resumed Game is scheduled to be played on
And it will NOT be displayed on the date that the original Suspended Game was played on

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Doubleheader present
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then both games will get it's own block
And the game's will be in the correct order based on start time

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user looks at the date bar
And there is a Doubleheader present
And the first game has been completed
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the second game will become the "featured" game

title: Game Details
custom_preconds: User is on the Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Team Page is loaded
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a persistent MLB.TV button will display on the upper left
And a team logo will display in the top middle
And a persistent Gameday Audio button will display on the upper right
And you are able to switch teams using the drop-down arrow next to the team logo
And the team color branding will be applied to the page
(CHECK FOR ALL TEAMS)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Team Page has loaded
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a total of four games will be displayed at the top below the header

custom_steps_separated.content: When a particular day is tapped
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Main Game Detail section displays for that particular game

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game tapped from the Date Bar is in a Preview State
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Game Detail top section will display the Preview state correctly which includes the team logos, probable pitchers and team records

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is a in a Preview State
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then tapping on the TICKETS Button:
- will open up the Tickets page for the Home Team

Then tapping on the PREVIEW Button:
- Then the two teams win/loss record will display
- Then the away team will be listed first on the left side followed by the home team on the right side of the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Postponed state
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then PPD will display for the game

(check all postponed reasons)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Cancelled State
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the word Cancelled is displayed

(Check all reasons)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Delayed Start - Ceremony and/or Delayed - Ceremony
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the word "Ceremony" will display instead of Delayed Start and/or Delayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a live state and the game is in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a live linescore will display on the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a live state and the game is in progress
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we will see the active bases in the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the game is in progress and it is in either a Delayed Start and/or and in-game Delayed State

(Check all reasons and use the Game States Page on the Wiki)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Game Detail section will display the word "Delayed" and/or "Delayed Start"

(as of now we are displaying the reasons)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Suspended state
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The Game Detail will display the word or abbreviation "susp"
And the Resume Date will be displayed below the game state

custom_steps_separated.content: When the app is backgrounded and user returns to team page
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then when you bring the app back to the foreground, the Team Page Linescore updates automatically

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has a Favorite team set and then taps on Gameday or Scoreboard from the Team Page and observes the game for a few innings and then taps back on the Team Page

https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-9746
custom_steps_separated.expected: The Game Detail section should update immediately when pushing on the view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user a Favorite Team set and is on the Team Page and the Game Detail section is loading and taps on another part of the app (Team Picker, News) and then taps back on Team Page 

https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-9756
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the 4/5 day Scoreboard and Game Detail will load with the current data

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game tapped from the Date Bar is in a final state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Game Detail will display a Final state linescore

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in progress and/or a final state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the away team name will display above the home team name in the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in progress and/or Final state and has extra innings
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then we can swipe/scroll through innings in the linescore from left to right

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is completed early
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Completed Early displays as "F/5" for example

custom_steps_separated.content: When the game is in a Forfeit state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the word Forfeit displays correctly

custom_steps_separated.content: When the MiLB.TV media is enabled for a particular game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the MLB.TV buttons will be visible below the Preview/Linescore for the game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the team's current game is in an in progress and/or Final State
And we tap the Gameday Button
And we tap the Box Score Button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the appropriate sections will open successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When you perform a swipe gesture from left to right or from right to left
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the day will change
And the game detail will change for that day

custom_steps_separated.content: When swiping through the specific Games
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Game Detail section display two team's matchup, game time and stadium name

custom_steps_separated.content: When the device time zone is changed to EST, CT, MT, PST
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then all time zones display correctly in the main section (EST, CT, MT, MST & PST)
EST - New York
CT - New Orleans
MT - Denver
PST - San Diego

custom_steps_separated.content: When the device time is 10 AM on the following day
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Game Detail section will populate that days game info
And before 10AM the previous day will be displayed on the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the game details for that day that is two or more days in advance from the current date
Or has swiped to a date that is two or more days in advance from the current date
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will not see the Win/Loss Record for either team

title: No-Hitter/Perfect Game Indicator
custom_preconds:
UI/UX Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=55312418

Screen: https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/IAB-10511

http://gd.qa.mlb.com/components/game/mlb/year_2015/month_07/day_27/master_scoreboard.xml
is_perfect_game="Y" is_no_hitter="N"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for Perfect Game
and the user is on the Team Page for one of the two teams involved
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator will display in the Game Detail section next to the inning information

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for Perfect Game
and the user is on the Team Page for that team
and changes the team to the other team in the perfect game
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator will display in the Game Detail section next to the inning information

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for Perfect Game
and the user is on the Team Page for that team
and changes the team to the another team not
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator will not be displayed in the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in a suspended state after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for Perfect Game
and the user is on the Team Page for that team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Perfect Game indicator will display in the Game Detail section next to the game state information

*Check different game states

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in a postponed state after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for Perfect Game
and the user is on the Team Page for that team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator will display in the Game Detail section next to the game state information

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is final
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a Perfect Game
and the user is on the Team Page for one of the two teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator will display in the Game Detail section next to Final

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is final
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a Perfect Game
and the user is on the Team Page for one of the two teams
and taps on previous or next games in the 4/5 day Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Perfect Game indicator will display only for the one game and will not be seen on other days/games

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for No Hitter
and the user is on the Team Page for that team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the No-Hitter indicator will display in the Game Detail section next to the inning information

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for No-Hitter
and the user is on the Team Page for that team
and changes the team to the another team not
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the No-Hitter indicator will not be displayed in the Game Detail section

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in a suspended state after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for No-Hiter
and the user is on the Team Page for that team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the No-Hitter indicator will display in the Game Detail section next to the game state information

*Check different game states

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in a postponed state after the 6th inning
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for No-Hiter
and the user is on the Team Page for that team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the No-Hitter indicator will display in the Game Detail section next to the game state information

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is final
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a No-Hitter
and the user is on the Team Page for one of the two teams
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the No-Hitter indicator will display in the Game Detail section next to Final

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is in progress 
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a Perfect Game (or No-Hitter)
and the user is on the Team Page
and the Hide Scores is On
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the scores and game data and Perfect Game (or No-Hitter) indicator are hidden

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the Team Page with the Perfect Game Indicator (or No-Hitter)
and Shake to Toggle is On
and the user shakes the device to turn on Hide Scores
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the scores and Perfect Game (or No-Hitter) indicator on the Scoreboard are hidden

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the Perfect Game or No-hitter indicator
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then nothing will happen and the indicator is for informational/visual purposes only

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a device is set to Spanish
and the flag on master_scoreboard is set for a Perfect Game (or No-Hitter)
and the indicator is on the Scoreboard
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the text in the indicator text will display in Spanish

No-Hitter - Sin hit
Perfect Game - Juego perfecto

title: Team Schedule - Calendar
custom_preconds: User is on a Team Page view in First Pitch iPhone

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on the Schedule block on the Date Bar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Team Schedule view is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the colors of the calendar days
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the colors for home games are correctly using the selected team's primary color. The colors for away games are white.

custom_steps_separated.content: When you attempt to scroll backwards on the Calendar and attempt to scroll forwards on the Calendar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Calendar correctly honors the season boundaries that have been set (firstAllowedDay and lastAllowedDay)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you tap on Calendar and/or List
And you navigate to a different Team Page Schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the 'Schedule' view that opens will open to the last view selected on the previous Team Schedule Page

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the calendar cells
custom_steps_separated.expected: Games not in a final state will NOT contain 'W' or 'L' in the cells

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the times in the calendar cells with 24-hour enabled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Game times displayed in 24-hour format fit in the cells

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a calendar date cell with no game scheduled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then nothing happens. Repeat this step for both earlier and later calendar months.

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a calendar date cell with a game scheduled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then before any preview, in progress or wrap is displayed - a spinner is animated on the selected date cell. Repeat this step for both earlier and later calendar months.

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a game that has not been started
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see a preview Screen for that particular game

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game is placed into a postponement state

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/mobile/2013+Game+States
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the calendar cell for that game is reflected correctly

Repeat this step for Postponed, Canceled, Forfeit and Suspended game types

custom_steps_separated.content: When a split squad game is on the calendar
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a SS graphic should appear in the top right corner of that particular calendar date cell which has a split squad game

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a split squad day calendar cell
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an action sheet will be displayed showing the two games on that date

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a split squad day calendar cell of games that have not been played yet
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an action sheet will be displayed showing the starting time for each game

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a split squad day calendar cell of games that are finalized
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an action sheet will be displayed showing both games in a finalized state

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on a game from the split squad action sheet
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought to the appropriate game

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a Gameday link for a game that is in progress or final as a full MiLB First Pitch user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then Gameday will open to the selected game

custom_steps_separated.content:
INVALID
When you tap on the top right corner icon
custom_steps_separated.expected:
INVALID
Message appears to subscribe to the team's calendar

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on Download
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then message appears to subscribe to the calendar

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on Subscribe
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then message appears stating user is subscribed and given option to View Events

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then you will be returned to the appropriate Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap the List segment control
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team schedule is displayed in a listed format

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the team schedule list date font
custom_steps_separated.expected: Date font remains consistent throughout the list

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the team schedule list game information
custom_steps_separated.expected: Team games are displayed with the day of the week, the date, the opponent

custom_steps_separated.content: Review opponent logos
custom_steps_separated.expected: Opponent logos are displayed correctly in the list

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the opponent name text color
custom_steps_separated.expected: The opponent name should be using the correct color of that team

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the pitchers shown next to games in the list view for finalized games
custom_steps_separated.expected: Pitcher names are shown with W/L (Winner/Loser) next to the correct players

custom_steps_separated.content: When a final game is shown on the team's schedule list that was a loss
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the score text color will be RED

custom_steps_separated.content: When a final game is shown on the team's schedule list that was a win
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the score text color will be BLACK

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the pitchers shown next to games that have not been started
custom_steps_separated.expected: Probable pitcher names are displayed if available or TBD

custom_steps_separated.content: When a game is in progress state
custom_steps_separated.expected: Pitcher names are not displayed in this view

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the scores in the list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the game scores are shown for completed games along with a W or L for the results of the selected team

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the game times in the list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the time of game is shown for each incomplete game in the list

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on the ticket icon next to a game in the list view
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to ticket purchasing for the selected game

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a game that has not started
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is shown the Preview window for that game

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a game that is in progress as a MiLB First Pitch full user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to Gameday for that particular game

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a game that is in progress as a At Bat lite user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to Gameday for that particular game

custom_steps_separated.content: When a split squad game is on the team's schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they will appear in the List individually as their own cells

custom_steps_separated.content: When a double header is on the team's schedule
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they will appear in the List individually as their own cells

custom_steps_separated.content: When you switch between Calendar and List on the segment controller
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the view changes without any issues. The month being viewed in each segment is retained when switching back and forth (i.e. the view is not being reset to today's date)

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap the back button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then you will be returned to the appropriate Team Page

custom_steps_separated.content: When Media Wall content is loaded
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then you will see the top 5 News stories from the team's News index
And we will be able to swipe to the previous and next stories

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap on a News article from the Media Wall
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the News article opens successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When you tap the play button on a video inside a News Article
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the News video plays

custom_steps_separated.content: When media wall performs carousel (or user swipes through) and the user is lite
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an advertisement will appear

custom_steps_separated.content: When swiping through the Media Wall content and the user is a Full user
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then an Ad will NOT appear

title: Team News
custom_preconds: Given user is on the Team page

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps the "See All" button on top of the News Media Wall
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the appropriate team news displays for the selected team

REPEAT for each team

custom_steps_separated.content: Review the news list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Articles display accurately and fit appropriately
Images display accurately and fit appropriately
Articles without an image are given the default image

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on the font icon within a news article
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the font size changes successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When user swipes left or right within a news article
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the article changes to the next or previous article

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on the Share button within a news article
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a pop window prompts the user to select either Twitter , Post to Facebook , Email a Link or Message

custom_steps_separated.content: When the Videos module of the Team page loads
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the top 5 videos from the team's video index in a 5 card carousel

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the Videos within the Video module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see a 5 card carousel with the following:
*video thumbnail with a play button in the upper left
*title
*Video Duration (MM:SS) and Date

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user views the video duration and the video is only in seconds (00:29)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the two leading zeros  for the minutes

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user vides the video duration and the video is a single digit minute
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will not see the leading zero in front of the minute

(Show 1:34 and not 01:34)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user swipes left/right on the Videos module
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is able to successfully swipe over to the beginning/end of the video list (5 videos)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a Video in the Videos module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video will launch in "Full Screen" mode
And the video will play successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When one video is finishes playing
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then Auto-Playback view appears with the following:
X in the upper left to dismiss Auto-Playback view
'Play again' icon and text to replay the previous video
'Play next video' icon and text to play the next video in the index
'Next video will begin in <time>' text will count down

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps the 'See All' button above the Video module
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user is taken to the Team's video index

title: Team Video
custom_preconds: User is on a team page in the At Bat app on iPhone and taps "See All" in the Videos header

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user examines the contents of a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the thumbnail will contain a title in white bolded font 
And the time/date stamp will be below the the title 
And will contain an info button in the top right corner
 And will contain a share button in the bottom right corner

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on the share icon in the corner of a video highlight
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Tapping on 'Tweet' and it opens Twitter dialog successfully
Tapping on 'Post to Facebook' and it opens Facebook dialog successfully
Tapping on 'Email a Link' and it opens Email dialog successfully
Tapping on 'Message' and it opens messaging app successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a video thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then video will play inline and the video controller will have a bottom overlay with the following:
Play/Pause, Elasped (M:SS), Buffered, Remaining (M:SS), Full Screen arrow, Share button

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a highlight video thumbnail and taps on Full Screen button on the bottom overlay
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight will play in Portrait Full screen mode

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video and turns the iPhone landscape
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight will play in Landscape Full screen mode

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user plays a video in full screen mode and the video finishes
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the next highlight will automatically start

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user searches for highlights
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the search results are accurate and pertinent to the team selected

custom_steps_separated.content: When a Freewheel Pre-roll ad is targeted for a Lite user and a user taps on a video on demand
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a 30 second pre-roll video will play followed by the video that is requested for the user

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user is viewing a Team page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a 300x250 ad will appear below the Videos module
And above the Tickets module

title: Team Tickets
custom_preconds:
NOTE:
iPhone does not support have Tickets Module like iPad, only Tickets link in Schedules section at the top

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on a ticket link
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the webview will open in SFSafariViewController

custom_steps_separated.content:
When you are on a team's page
And there is an away game for that team displaying in the 5 day schedule
And you tap on the tickets link for that away game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a message will popup stating: 'Attention: You've selected an away game that will be played at another ballpark. If you choose to continue, tickets will be processed and fulfilled by the host team.'
AND tapping 'Go Back' will take you back to the schedule
AND tapping 'Buy Tickets' will take you the the home team's stadium page

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user views the Tickets module
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the next 3 home games will be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: When user taps on green "Find Seats" button located in each game cell
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then user is directed to the corresponding games ticket menu purchase page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the Ticket module
And there are fewer than 3 Home games left on the schedule for that team
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the games that are available will be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the Ticket module
And there are no games available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the view will be collapsed
And only the header with the "See All" button will be displayed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user views the Ticket module
And there is a game with no tickets available
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the "Find Seats" button will be removed
